body.p:
Hartford Ky June 29th 1864
Hon Thomas E Bramlette
Govenor of Kentucky

The undersigned petitioners would respectfully represent that L. D. Kirkendoll at the March Term of the Ohio Circuit ^1859^ had a judgment recovered against him for not for Seventy five Dollars. And lost prosecution.

When the Judgment was recovered against him he was in the State of Illinoise sick and could not attend the trial. He says he was not guilty of the riot. which was proven by one James Warren. who he has since had Indicted for perjury. We would further represent that the said Kirkendoll is poor man. and a man of family. And we believe the collection of the fine would break him up
We further believe the prosecution was gotten up through Malice. And that under all the circumstances this as a clear case for Executive Clemency. And we do hope you will remit his fine

A. L. Morton Clerk Ohio Cir Court
Ed. B. Ellis Deputy " " "
John Chapeze Comlth's atty.
R. J. Moseley Clk O. C. C

Ohio Cir Ct
vs
L D. Kirkendoll
Riot
$75-
Remitted 5th July/64
